comments.text:
In 4.0 we have a new last locale: 'zu'. Rail pointed out to me that zh-TW is hardcoded as the last locale in at least one place, here: https://github.com/fwenzel/tuxedo/blob/master/sentry/sentry.pl#L211

We should stop hardcoding it, or at the very least fix it to be hardcoded per-branch.
comments.raw_text:
In 4.0 we have a new last locale: 'zu'. Rail pointed out to me that zh-TW is hardcoded as the last locale in at least one place, here: https://github.com/fwenzel/tuxedo/blob/master/sentry/sentry.pl#L211

We should stop hardcoding it, or at the very least fix it to be hardcoded per-branch.

The zh-TW hardcoding was added as a stopgap fix for bug 457614, which still needs a real solution.  This has become a much bigger problem because different products and different versions of the same products have different last locales, and that "hardcoded zh-TW locale" has become a huge if/then block with a hodgepodge of conditions, and it's really not going to scale much further.
